```{r convert overall rating}

glassdoor_reviews$overall_rating <- gsub("Very Dissatisfied", "1", glassdoor_reviews$overall_rating)
glassdoor_reviews$overall_rating <- as.numeric(glassdoor_reviews$overall_rating)
```

```{r install packages 6}
install.packages("ranger")
```

```{r load libraries 6}
library(ranger)
```



```{r split data}
#Split data into training and testing sets
set.seed(123)
train_index <- sample(1:nrow(glassdoor_reviews), 0.7 * nrow(glassdoor_reviews))
train_data <- glassdoor_reviews[train_index, ]
test_data <- glassdoor_reviews[-train_index, ]
```


```{r train model}
#Train the Random Forest model using ranger
rf_model <- ranger(overall_rating ~ work_life_balance + comp_benefits + career_opp + senior_mgmt + culture_values, data = train_data, importance = "impurity")
rf_model
```

```{r make predictions}
# Make predictions using the testing data
predictions <- predict(rf_model, data = test_data)$predictions
```


```{r evaluate the model}
#Evaluate the model on the testing data using Root Mean Squared Error
rmse <- sqrt(mean((predictions - test_data$overall_rating)^2))
print(paste("RMSE:", rmse))
```

```{r evaluate the model with r squared}
#R-squared (R^2) - a measure of variance explained
r_squared <- 1 - sum((test_data$overall_rating - predictions)^2) / sum((test_data$overall_rating - mean(test_data$overall_rating))^2)
print(paste("R-squared:", r_squared))
```

```{r plot actual vs predicted}
#Plot actual vs predicted values
plot(predictions, test_data$overall_rating, xlab = "Predicted", ylab = "Actual", main = "Actual vs Predicted Values")
abline(0, 1, col = "red") 
```


```{r variable importance}
#Variable importance
importance(rf_model)
plot(importance(rf_model), type = "l") 
```
